Aviastar dan KMP Pulo Tello Tak Beroperasi, Hasil Bumi dan Laut Enggano Menumpuk
05 Nov 2019, 18:18 by Roki EP


Aviastar dan KMP Pulo Tello Tak Beroperasi, Hasil Bumi dan Laut Enggano Menumpuk

KBRN, Bengkulu : Akses transportasi baik udara maupun laut untuk masyarakat di Pulau Enggano Kabupaten Bengkulu Utara, Provinsi Bengkulukembali terhambat. Mengingat pesawat Aviastar yang melayani penerbangan perintis rute Mukomuko-Bengkulu-Enggano Pulang Pergi (PP) tidak beroperasi, ditambah lagi Kapal Fery (KMP) Pulo Tello saat ini tengah naik docking atau perawatan.
Ketua Forum Komunikasi Kepala Desa (FKKD)Kecamatan Enggano, Redy Heloman Kaitoraketika dihubungimengatakan, tidak beroperasinya pesawat Aviastar sudah terjadi sejak Agustus lalu. Padahal bagi masyarakat Enggano, jalur penerbangan udara saat ini menjadi salah satu andalan untuk memperlancar akses transportasi, baik pergi ataupun kembali pulang ke Pulau Enggano.
Dikatakan, derita masyarakat bertambah, setelah Kapal Ferry Pulo Tello tengah naik docking,secara tidak langsung menyebabkan hasil laut dan bumi Enggano menumpuk dan terancam membusuk.
"Saat ini memang transportasi menggunakan Kapal Perintis Sabuk Nusantara 52. Tapi dikabarkan telah habis jadwal berlayar ke Enggano.Kemudian Kapal Perintis itu muatannya terbatas, untuk diminhta ada solusi dari Pemerintah," harapnya, Selasa, (5/11/2019).
Sementara secara terpisah, Kepala Dinas Perhubungan(Dishub) ProvinsiBengkulu Darpinuddin melalui Sekretaris, Syafril ketika dikonfirmasi tak menampikkan jika beberapa bulan terakhir pesawat Aviastar tak lagi beroperasi, lantaran sudah habis masa berlaku struktur limitnyaatau kekuatan struktur pesawat, dan tentu saja harus diperbaiki guna menjamin keamanan dan keselamatan penerbangan.
"Kondisi ini menyebabkan izin struktur limit yang dimaksud, harus diperpanjang lagi. Dari konfirmasi dengan pihak maskapai, izin sedang dalam kepengurusan. Lalu pihak maskapaiberusaha mencari pesawat pengganti jenis Caravan. Jika bulan ini proses perpanjangan izin selesai, maka pihak maskapai kembali beroperasi dengan pesawat DHC 6 yang selama ini digunakan," terangnya.
Lebih jauh terkait penerbangan perintis ini juga, pihaknya melalui Gubernur Bengkulu sudah bersurat ke Direktur Jendral Perhubungan Udara Kemenhub RIyang intinya meminta pesawat Aviastar kembali melayani penerbangan perintis rute Mukomuko-Bengkulu-Enggano PP.
â€œSurat itu kita layangkan karena pihak maskapai kontraknya memang dengan Kemenhub, yang berakhir Desember tahun ini," demikian Syafril.

Aviastar and KMP Pulo Tello Do Not Operate, Enggano Land and Sea Products Pile up
05 Nov 2019, 18:18 by Roki EP


Aviastar and KMP Pulo Tello Do Not Operate, Enggano Land and Sea Products Pile up

KBRN, Bengkulu: Access to transportation both air and sea for the people on Enggano Island, North Bengkulu Regency, Bengkulukback Province has been hampered. Considering the Aviastar aircraft serving pioneering flights on the Mukomuko-Bengkulu-Enggano Round-trip (PP) route is not operating, plus the Pulo Tello Ferry Boat (KMP) is currently on docking or maintenance.
The Head of the Enggano District Village Communication Forum (FKKD) Redy Heloman Kaitoraketika said that Aviastar aircraft had not been operating since last August. Whereas for the Enggano community, air flight paths are currently one of the mainstays for smooth access to transportation, whether going or returning to Enggano Island.
It is said, the suffering of the community increased, after the Pulo Tello Ferry was riding a docking, indirectly causing the sea and earth products of Enggano to pile up and threatened to rot.
"At present transportation uses the Nusantara Belt Pioneering Ship 52. But it is reported that the timetable for sailing to Enggano has been completed. Then the Pioneering Ship has a limited load, to be requested there is a solution from the Government," he hoped, Tuesday (5/11/2019).
While separately, the Head of the Transportation Service (Dishub) of Bengkulu Province Darpinuddin through the Secretary, Syafril when confirmed did not dismiss if the last few months the Aviastar aircraft was no longer in operation, because it had expired its limit structure or the strength of the aircraft structure, and of course had to be repaired to ensure safety and flight safety.
"This condition causes the permit limit structure in question, must be extended again. From the confirmation with the airline, the permit is under management. Then the airline is trying to find a replacement aircraft Caravan. If this month the permit renewal process is complete, then the airline will operate again with DHC aircraft 6 which has been used, "he explained.
Further related to this pioneering flight also, his party through the Governor of Bengkulu has written to the Director General of Civil Aviation of the Ministry of Transportation, which essentially asks Aviastar aircraft to return to pioneering flights on the Mukomuko-Bengkulu-Enggano PP route.
"We sent the letter because the airline contract was indeed with the Ministry of Transportation, which ended in December this year," said Syafril.
